definition: to arrange/to exhibit/to move to and fro/a pendulum

sentences.english: I was ushered into a book-lined study.
sentences.chinese: 我被領進了一個擺滿了一排排書的房間。

sentences.english: That's a mantelpiece cluttered up with all kinds of doodad .
sentences.chinese: 那是個擺滿了各種小玩意兒的壁爐架。

sentences.english: A long thin table against the front wall was covered with gorgeous jewelry.
sentences.chinese: 而靠牆的一條長桌上則擺滿了琳琅滿目的首飾。

sentences.english: Her bedroom is lined from floor to ceiling with clothes and dolls.
sentences.chinese: 她的臥室裏，從地板到屋頂擺滿了衣服和玩偶。

sentences.english: These tables were loaded down with peaches and wine and four attendants guarding them.
sentences.chinese: 桌子上擺滿了仙桃和美酒，有四個守衛人員看守。

sentences.english: The shelves in his house were filled with trophies that attested to his prowess.
sentences.chinese: 他家裏的架子上擺滿了見證他勇武的獎盃。

sentences.english: Then she found her stairs covered in toys.
sentences.chinese: 接着她發現樓梯上擺滿了玩具。

sentences.english: In the mortuary there are many stiffened corpses.
sentences.chinese: 停屍房中擺滿了僵冷的屍體。

sentences.english: Buildings outside were swaying. A six-foot tall cabinet full of books was rocking.
sentences.chinese: 一個六英尺高，擺滿書的架子也在搖晃。

sentences.english: The square was bedecked with flags and flowers.
sentences.chinese: 廣場掛滿了各色彩旗和擺滿了鮮花。

sentences.english: The racks in this fruit store are stacked with fresh fruit.
sentences.chinese: 貨架上擺滿了鮮潤的水果。

sentences.english: Instead of nothing being in the windows of the shops, everything started to come up.
sentences.chinese: 商店的櫥窗中不再空無一物，而是擺滿了商品。

sentences.english: The effect is like a room overloaded with votive candles.
sentences.chinese: 看上去就像一間擺滿了蠟燭的房子。

sentences.english: Then there were plenty of mouth-watering, delicious food on the table.
sentences.chinese: 桌子上擺滿了令人垂涎的，美味的食物。

sentences.english: The room was full of wooden furniture.
sentences.chinese: 房間裏擺滿了木製傢俱。
